summary: This is an email from November 30, 2018, forwarding a summary of a 2011 legal proceeding where Jeffrey Epstein petitioned to have his sex offender status reduced in New York. A New York prosecutor argued on Epstein's behalf, but the judge denied the petition, expressing astonishment at the prosecutor's actions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein petitioned in 2011 to have his New York sex offender status reduced from level 3 (highest risk). He is described as a serial sex offender accused of molesting many girls.

persons.name: Ruth Shillingford
persons.context: The judge who denied Epstein's 2011 petition to reduce his sex offender status. She expressed astonishment that a prosecutor would argue on behalf of a serial sex offender.

connections.description: Shillingford was the judge presiding over Epstein's 2011 petition to reduce his sex offender registration level. She denied his petition.

events.title: Epstein's Petition to Reduce Sex Offender Status
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein petitioned a New York court to have his sex offender registration level reduced from level 3 (highest risk). A New York prosecutor argued on his behalf, but Judge Ruth Shillingford denied the petition.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: In 2011, Jeffrey Epstein, classified as a Level 3 (highest risk) sex offender in New York, petitioned to have his status reduced.
A prosecutor from the New York County District Attorney's office argued on Epstein's behalf, citing that the Florida case never led to an indictment and that victims failed to cooperate.
New York Supreme Court Justice Ruth Shillingford denied the petition, expressing astonishment that a prosecutor would make such a request for a serial sex offender accused of molesting many girls.
The document is an email from November 30, 2018, forwarding information from a Miami Herald article about this 2011 proceeding.
